skill.name: clojure-write
skill.description: Guide Clojure and ClojureScript development using REPL-driven workflow, coding conventions, and best practices. Use when writing, developing, or refactoring Clojure/ClojureScript code.
skill.summary: Guide Clojure and ClojureScript development using REPL-driven workflow, coding conventions, and best...

security_audit.summary: No executable code or network activity found. The skill contains guidance text only. No data access or tool usage is embedded.

content.user_title: Improve Clojure code with REPL-driven guidance
content.value_statement: You need reliable guidance for Clojure and ClojureScript changes. This skill provides a REPL-driven workflow, conventions, and editing rules.
actual_capabilities: Provides a namespace evaluation command example
Points to shared workflow, style, and command references
limitations: Does not run a REPL or execute code
Assumes access to project specific tools like ./bin/mage
Does not include test generation steps

use_cases.title: Plan a REPL workflow
use_cases.description: Get a step by step REPL development approach before coding.

use_cases.title: Standardize conventions
use_cases.description: Share consistent Clojure editing rules with the team.

use_cases.title: Validate namespace edits
use_cases.description: Follow guidance to load and check namespaces safely.

prompt_templates.title: Start a REPL workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline a REPL driven workflow for a small Clojure feature and list the first functions to prototype.

prompt_templates.title: Refactor small function
prompt_templates.prompt: Suggest a REPL first refactor plan for a pure function and how to test it before integrating.

prompt_templates.title: Validate namespace edits
prompt_templates.prompt: Show the steps to evaluate a namespace with ./bin/mage and verify changes before composing features.

prompt_templates.title: Apply editing rules
prompt_templates.prompt: List the critical Clojure editing rules I must follow when updating a file and how to keep alignment readable.

output_examples.input: Help me plan a REPL driven change for a Clojure function.
output: Break the feature into two small functions
Test each function in the REPL with edge cases
Move working code into the namespace file
Re-evaluate the namespace after each change

best_practices: Test small functions in the REPL before composing
Verify readability after every Clojure change
anti_patterns: Writing large functions before REPL testing
Ignoring alignment in tabular code sections

faq.question: Which platforms does this skill support?
faq.answer: It is written for use with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code environments.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance only and does not execute code or modify files.

faq.question: Can it integrate with clojure-mcp tools?
faq.answer: Yes, it advises using clojure-mcp tools when available.

faq.question: Does it access my data?
faq.answer: No, it contains guidance text and no data access logic.

faq.question: What if my namespace will not load?
faq.answer: Re-evaluate the namespace and check for syntax or formatting issues.

faq.question: How does it compare to a full IDE?
faq.answer: It offers workflow guidance but no execution or editor automation.
